interfaces.hil.test_automation¶

Source: src\interfaces\hil\test_automation.py

Module Overview¶

Automated testing framework for HIL systems. This module provides comprehensive test automation capabilities including test case management, assertion validation, performance testing, and automated report generation for control system validation.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#======================= src/interfaces/hil/test_automation.py ========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Automated testing framework for HIL systems.
  7This module provides comprehensive test automation capabilities including
  8test case management, assertion validation, performance testing, and
  9automated report generation for control system validation.
 10"""
 11
 12import asyncio
 13import time
 14import json
 15from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 16from typing import Dict, Any, Optional, List, Callable, Union
 17from enum import Enum
 18import logging
 19
 20
 21class TestStatus(Enum):
 22    """Test execution status enumeration."""
 23    PENDING = "pending"
 24    RUNNING = "running"
 25    PASSED = "passed"
 26    FAILED = "failed"
 27    SKIPPED = "skipped"
 28    ERROR = "error"
 29
 30
 31class AssertionType(Enum):
 32    """Test assertion type enumeration."""
 33    EQUALS = "equals"
 34    LESS_THAN = "less_than"
 35    GREATER_THAN = "greater_than"
 36    WITHIN_RANGE = "within_range"
 37    WITHIN_TOLERANCE = "within_tolerance"
 38    STEADY_STATE = "steady_state"
 39    STABILITY = "stability"
 40    RESPONSE_TIME = "response_time"
 41
 42
 43@dataclass
 44class TestAssertion:
 45    """Test assertion configuration."""
 46    name: str
 47    assertion_type: AssertionType
 48    target_signal: str
 49    expected_value: Any
 50    tolerance: float = 0.01
 51    timeout: float = 10.0
 52    description: str = ""
 53
 54
 55@dataclass
 56class TestCase:
 57    """Individual test case configuration."""
 58    name: str
 59    description: str
 60    duration: float
 61    initial_conditions: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 62    test_inputs: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 63    assertions: List[TestAssertion] = field(default_factory=list)
 64    fault_scenarios: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 65    setup_commands: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 66    teardown_commands: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 67    timeout: float = 60.0
 68    retry_count: int = 0
 69
 70
 71@dataclass
 72class TestSuite:
 73    """Test suite containing multiple test cases."""
 74    name: str
 75    description: str
 76    test_cases: List[TestCase] = field(default_factory=list)
 77    setup_suite: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 78    teardown_suite: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 79    parallel_execution: bool = False
 80    max_parallel: int = 4
 81
 82
 83@dataclass
 84class TestResult:
 85    """Test execution result."""
 86    test_name: str
 87    status: TestStatus
 88    start_time: float
 89    end_time: float
 90    duration: float
 91    assertions_passed: int = 0
 92    assertions_failed: int = 0
 93    error_message: Optional[str] = None
 94    data_log: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 95    performance_metrics: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)
 96
 97
 98class HILTestFramework:
 99    """
100    Comprehensive test automation framework for HIL systems.
101
102    Provides automated test execution, assertion validation,
103    performance testing, and report generation capabilities.
104    """
105
106    def __init__(self, hil_system: 'EnhancedHILSystem', test_scenarios: Optional[List['TestScenario']] = None):
107        """Initialize HIL test framework."""
108        self._hil_system = hil_system
109        self._test_scenarios = test_scenarios or []
110
111        # Test management
112        self._test_suites: Dict[str, TestSuite] = {}
113        self._test_results: List[TestResult] = []
114        self._current_test: Optional[TestCase] = None
115
116        # Execution control
117        self._running = False
118        self._stop_event = asyncio.Event()
119
120        # Data collection
121        self._test_data: Dict[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]] = {}
122        self._assertion_results: List[Dict[str, Any]] = []
123
124        # Configuration
125        self._logger = logging.getLogger("hil_test_framework")
126        self._report_generator = TestReportGenerator()
127
128    def add_test_suite(self, suite: TestSuite) -> None:
129        """Add test suite to framework."""
130        self._test_suites[suite.name] = suite
131        self._logger.info(f"Added test suite: {suite.name}")
132
133    def add_test_case(self, suite_name: str, test_case: TestCase) -> None:
134        """Add test case to existing suite."""
135        if suite_name in self._test_suites:
136            self._test_suites[suite_name].test_cases.append(test_case)
137            self._logger.info(f"Added test case {test_case.name} to suite {suite_name}")
138
139    async def run_test_suite(self, suite_name: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
140        """Run complete test suite."""
141        try:
142            if suite_name not in self._test_suites:
143                raise ValueError(f"Test suite {suite_name} not found")
144
145            suite = self._test_suites[suite_name]
146            self._logger.info(f"Running test suite: {suite_name}")
147
148            start_time = time.time()
149            results = []
150
151            # Setup suite
152            await self._execute_setup_commands(suite.setup_suite)
153
154            # Execute test cases
155            if suite.parallel_execution:
156                results = await self._run_parallel_tests(suite)
157            else:
158                results = await self._run_sequential_tests(suite)
159
160            # Teardown suite
161            await self._execute_teardown_commands(suite.teardown_suite)
162
163            end_time = time.time()
164
165            # Generate suite report
166            suite_result = {
167                'suite_name': suite_name,
168                'start_time': start_time,
169                'end_time': end_time,
170                'duration': end_time - start_time,
171                'total_tests': len(results),
172                'passed': sum(1 for r in results if r.status == TestStatus.PASSED),
173                'failed': sum(1 for r in results if r.status == TestStatus.FAILED),
174                'errors': sum(1 for r in results if r.status == TestStatus.ERROR),
175                'results': results
176            }
177
178            self._logger.info(f"Completed test suite {suite_name}: "
179                            f"{suite_result['passed']}/{suite_result['total_tests']} passed")
180
181            return suite_result
182
183        except Exception as e:
184            self._logger.error(f"Error running test suite {suite_name}: {e}")
185            return {'suite_name': suite_name, 'error': str(e)}
186
187    async def run_test_case(self, test_case: TestCase) -> TestResult:
188        """Run individual test case."""
189        try:
190            self._current_test = test_case
191            self._logger.info(f"Running test case: {test_case.name}")
192
193            start_time = time.time()
194
195            # Setup test
196            await self._execute_setup_commands(test_case.setup_commands)
197            await self._apply_initial_conditions(test_case.initial_conditions)
198
199            # Execute test
200            result = await self._execute_test_case(test_case)
201
202            # Teardown test
203            await self._execute_teardown_commands(test_case.teardown_commands)
204
205            end_time = time.time()
206            result.duration = end_time - start_time
207
208            self._test_results.append(result)
209            self._current_test = None
210
211            self._logger.info(f"Test case {test_case.name} completed: {result.status.value}")
212            return result
213
214        except Exception as e:
215            self._logger.error(f"Error running test case {test_case.name}: {e}")
216            return TestResult(
217                test_name=test_case.name,
218                status=TestStatus.ERROR,
219                start_time=start_time,
220                end_time=time.time(),
221                duration=time.time() - start_time,
222                error_message=str(e)
223            )
224
225    async def run_all_suites(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
226        """Run all configured test suites."""
227        try:
228            self._logger.info("Running all test suites")
229            suite_results = {}
230
231            for suite_name in self._test_suites:
232                result = await self.run_test_suite(suite_name)
233                suite_results[suite_name] = result
234
235            # Generate comprehensive report
236            report = await self._report_generator.generate_comprehensive_report(
237                suite_results, self._test_results
238            )
239
240            return report
241
242        except Exception as e:
243            self._logger.error(f"Error running all test suites: {e}")
244            return {'error': str(e)}
245
246    async def _run_sequential_tests(self, suite: TestSuite) -> List[TestResult]:
247        """Run test cases sequentially."""
248        results = []
249        for test_case in suite.test_cases:
250            result = await self.run_test_case(test_case)
251            results.append(result)
252        return results
253
254    async def _run_parallel_tests(self, suite: TestSuite) -> List[TestResult]:
255        """Run test cases in parallel."""
256        semaphore = asyncio.Semaphore(suite.max_parallel)
257
258        async def run_with_semaphore(test_case):
259            async with semaphore:
260                return await self.run_test_case(test_case)
261
262        tasks = [run_with_semaphore(tc) for tc in suite.test_cases]
263        return await asyncio.gather(*tasks)
264
265    async def _execute_test_case(self, test_case: TestCase) -> TestResult:
266        """Execute individual test case logic."""
267        result = TestResult(
268            test_name=test_case.name,
269            status=TestStatus.RUNNING,
270            start_time=time.time(),
271            end_time=0.0,
272            duration=0.0
273        )
274
275        try:
276            # Apply test inputs
277            await self._apply_test_inputs(test_case.test_inputs)
278
279            # Inject faults if specified
280            for fault_scenario in test_case.fault_scenarios:
281                await self._hil_system._fault_injector.execute_scenario(fault_scenario)
282
283            # Collect data and validate assertions
284            await self._run_test_assertions(test_case, result)
285
286            # Determine overall test result
287            if result.assertions_failed == 0:
288                result.status = TestStatus.PASSED
289            else:
290                result.status = TestStatus.FAILED
291
292        except asyncio.TimeoutError:
293            result.status = TestStatus.FAILED
294            result.error_message = f"Test timeout after {test_case.timeout}s"
295
296        except Exception as e:
297            result.status = TestStatus.ERROR
298            result.error_message = str(e)
299
300        result.end_time = time.time()
301        return result
302
303    async def _run_test_assertions(self, test_case: TestCase, result: TestResult) -> None:
304        """Run test assertions and collect results."""
305        test_start = time.time()
306        assertion_tasks = []
307
308        # Start assertion monitoring tasks
309        for assertion in test_case.assertions:
310            task = asyncio.create_task(
311                self._monitor_assertion(assertion, test_start, test_case.duration)
312            )
313            assertion_tasks.append(task)
314
315        # Wait for test duration or all assertions to complete
316        try:
317            await asyncio.wait_for(
318                asyncio.gather(*assertion_tasks),
319                timeout=test_case.timeout
320            )
321        except asyncio.TimeoutError:
322            # Cancel remaining tasks
323            for task in assertion_tasks:
324                task.cancel()
325
326        # Collect assertion results
327        for i, task in enumerate(assertion_tasks):
328            try:
329                if task.done() and not task.cancelled():
330                    assertion_result = await task
331                    if assertion_result['passed']:
332                        result.assertions_passed += 1
333                    else:
334                        result.assertions_failed += 1
335                    self._assertion_results.append(assertion_result)
336                else:
337                    result.assertions_failed += 1
338            except Exception as e:
339                result.assertions_failed += 1
340                self._logger.error(f"Assertion {test_case.assertions[i].name} error: {e}")
341
342    async def _monitor_assertion(self, assertion: TestAssertion,
343                               start_time: float, duration: float) -> Dict[str, Any]:
344        """Monitor and validate test assertion."""
345        try:
346            assertion_result = {
347                'name': assertion.name,
348                'type': assertion.assertion_type.value,
349                'target_signal': assertion.target_signal,
350                'expected_value': assertion.expected_value,
351                'passed': False,
352                'actual_value': None,
353                'timestamp': None,
354                'error_message': None
355            }
356
357            end_time = start_time + duration
358            check_interval = 0.01  # 10ms check interval
359
360            while time.time() < end_time:
361                # Get current signal value
362                current_value = await self._get_signal_value(assertion.target_signal)
363
364                # Validate assertion
365                validation_result = self._validate_assertion(assertion, current_value)
366
367                if validation_result['passed']:
368                    assertion_result.update({
369                        'passed': True,
370                        'actual_value': current_value,
371                        'timestamp': time.time() - start_time
372                    })
373                    break
374
375                await asyncio.sleep(check_interval)
376
377            # If assertion never passed, record final state
378            if not assertion_result['passed']:
379                final_value = await self._get_signal_value(assertion.target_signal)
380                assertion_result.update({
381                    'actual_value': final_value,
382                    'timestamp': duration,
383                    'error_message': f"Assertion failed: expected {assertion.expected_value}, got {final_value}"
384                })
385
386            return assertion_result
387
388        except Exception as e:
389            return {
390                'name': assertion.name,
391                'passed': False,
392                'error_message': str(e)
393            }
394
395    def _validate_assertion(self, assertion: TestAssertion, actual_value: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
396        """Validate individual assertion."""
397        try:
398            if assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.EQUALS:
399                passed = abs(float(actual_value) - float(assertion.expected_value)) <= assertion.tolerance
400
401            elif assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.LESS_THAN:
402                passed = float(actual_value) < float(assertion.expected_value)
403
404            elif assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.GREATER_THAN:
405                passed = float(actual_value) > float(assertion.expected_value)
406
407            elif assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.WITHIN_RANGE:
408                min_val, max_val = assertion.expected_value
409                passed = min_val <= float(actual_value) <= max_val
410
411            elif assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.WITHIN_TOLERANCE:
412                target_value, tolerance = assertion.expected_value
413                passed = abs(float(actual_value) - float(target_value)) <= tolerance
414
415            else:
416                passed = False
417
418            return {
419                'passed': passed,
420                'actual_value': actual_value
421            }
422
423        except Exception as e:
424            return {
425                'passed': False,
426                'error': str(e)
427            }
428
429    async def _get_signal_value(self, signal_name: str) -> Any:
430        """Get current value of specified signal."""
431        try:
432            # Get signal from HIL system data
433            hil_status = await self._hil_system.get_system_status()
434
435            # Search in input/output data
436            if signal_name in self._hil_system._input_data:
437                return self._hil_system._input_data[signal_name]
438            elif signal_name in self._hil_system._output_data:
439                return self._hil_system._output_data[signal_name]
440            elif signal_name in self._hil_system._simulation_data:
441                return self._hil_system._simulation_data[signal_name]
442            else:
443                # Try to get from devices
444                for device_id in self._hil_system._device_manager.list_devices():
445                    device = self._hil_system._device_manager.get_device(device_id)
446                    data = await device.read_data()
447                    if signal_name in data:
448                        return data[signal_name]
449
450                raise ValueError(f"Signal {signal_name} not found")
451
452        except Exception as e:
453            self._logger.error(f"Error getting signal {signal_name}: {e}")
454            return None
455
456    async def _execute_setup_commands(self, commands: List[str]) -> None:
457        """Execute setup commands."""
458        for command in commands:
459            try:
460                # Parse and execute command
461                await self._execute_command(command)
462            except Exception as e:
463                self._logger.error(f"Setup command failed: {command} - {e}")
464
465    async def _execute_teardown_commands(self, commands: List[str]) -> None:
466        """Execute teardown commands."""
467        for command in commands:
468            try:
469                await self._execute_command(command)
470            except Exception as e:
471                self._logger.error(f"Teardown command failed: {command} - {e}")
472
473    async def _execute_command(self, command: str) -> None:
474        """Execute individual command."""
475        # Simple command parser - would be expanded for specific needs
476        if command.startswith("set_"):
477            # Parse set commands: set_signal_name:value
478            parts = command[4:].split(":")
479            if len(parts) == 2:
480                signal_name, value = parts
481                await self._set_signal_value(signal_name, float(value))
482
483    async def _set_signal_value(self, signal_name: str, value: Any) -> None:
484        """Set signal value in HIL system."""
485        self._hil_system._output_data[signal_name] = value
486
487    async def _apply_initial_conditions(self, conditions: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
488        """Apply initial conditions for test."""
489        for signal_name, value in conditions.items():
490            await self._set_signal_value(signal_name, value)
491
492    async def _apply_test_inputs(self, inputs: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
493        """Apply test inputs."""
494        for signal_name, value in inputs.items():
495            await self._set_signal_value(signal_name, value)
496
497
498class TestReportGenerator:
499    """Generate comprehensive test reports."""
500
501    def __init__(self):
502        self._logger = logging.getLogger("test_report_generator")
503
504    async def generate_comprehensive_report(self, suite_results: Dict[str, Any],
505                                          test_results: List[TestResult]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
506        """Generate comprehensive test report."""
507        try:
508            report = {
509                'generated_at': time.time(),
510                'summary': self._generate_summary(suite_results, test_results),
511                'suite_results': suite_results,
512                'detailed_results': [self._result_to_dict(r) for r in test_results],
513                'statistics': self._generate_statistics(test_results),
514                'recommendations': self._generate_recommendations(test_results)
515            }
516
517            return report
518
519        except Exception as e:
520            self._logger.error(f"Error generating report: {e}")
521            return {'error': str(e)}
522
523    def _generate_summary(self, suite_results: Dict[str, Any],
524                         test_results: List[TestResult]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
525        """Generate test summary."""
526        total_tests = len(test_results)
527        passed = sum(1 for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.PASSED)
528        failed = sum(1 for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.FAILED)
529        errors = sum(1 for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.ERROR)
530
531        return {
532            'total_suites': len(suite_results),
533            'total_tests': total_tests,
534            'passed': passed,
535            'failed': failed,
536            'errors': errors,
537            'success_rate': passed / max(1, total_tests),
538            'total_duration': sum(r.duration for r in test_results)
539        }
540
541    def _generate_statistics(self, test_results: List[TestResult]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
542        """Generate test statistics."""
543        if not test_results:
544            return {}
545
546        durations = [r.duration for r in test_results]
547
548        return {
549            'avg_duration': sum(durations) / len(durations),
550            'max_duration': max(durations),
551            'min_duration': min(durations),
552            'total_assertions': sum(r.assertions_passed + r.assertions_failed for r in test_results),
553            'assertion_success_rate': sum(r.assertions_passed for r in test_results) /
554                                    max(1, sum(r.assertions_passed + r.assertions_failed for r in test_results))
555        }
556
557    def _generate_recommendations(self, test_results: List[TestResult]) -> List[str]:
558        """Generate test recommendations."""
559        recommendations = []
560
561        failed_tests = [r for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.FAILED]
562        if failed_tests:
563            recommendations.append(f"Review {len(failed_tests)} failed test cases for potential issues")
564
565        error_tests = [r for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.ERROR]
566        if error_tests:
567            recommendations.append(f"Fix {len(error_tests)} test cases with execution errors")
568
569        return recommendations
570
571    def _result_to_dict(self, result: TestResult) -> Dict[str, Any]:
572        """Convert test result to dictionary."""
573        return {
574            'test_name': result.test_name,
575            'status': result.status.value,
576            'start_time': result.start_time,
577            'end_time': result.end_time,
578            'duration': result.duration,
579            'assertions_passed': result.assertions_passed,
580            'assertions_failed': result.assertions_failed,
581            'error_message': result.error_message,
582            'performance_metrics': result.performance_metrics
583        }

1class TestStatus(Enum):
2    """Test execution status enumeration."""
3    PENDING = "pending"
4    RUNNING = "running"
5    PASSED = "passed"
6    FAILED = "failed"
7    SKIPPED = "skipped"
8    ERROR = "error"

HILTestFramework¶

Comprehensive test automation framework for HIL systems.

Provides automated test execution, assertion validation, performance testing, and report generation capabilities.

Source Code¶

  1class HILTestFramework:
  2    """
  3    Comprehensive test automation framework for HIL systems.
  4
  5    Provides automated test execution, assertion validation,
  6    performance testing, and report generation capabilities.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, hil_system: 'EnhancedHILSystem', test_scenarios: Optional[List['TestScenario']] = None):
 10        """Initialize HIL test framework."""
 11        self._hil_system = hil_system
 12        self._test_scenarios = test_scenarios or []
 13
 14        # Test management
 15        self._test_suites: Dict[str, TestSuite] = {}
 16        self._test_results: List[TestResult] = []
 17        self._current_test: Optional[TestCase] = None
 18
 19        # Execution control
 20        self._running = False
 21        self._stop_event = asyncio.Event()
 22
 23        # Data collection
 24        self._test_data: Dict[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]] = {}
 25        self._assertion_results: List[Dict[str, Any]] = []
 26
 27        # Configuration
 28        self._logger = logging.getLogger("hil_test_framework")
 29        self._report_generator = TestReportGenerator()
 30
 31    def add_test_suite(self, suite: TestSuite) -> None:
 32        """Add test suite to framework."""
 33        self._test_suites[suite.name] = suite
 34        self._logger.info(f"Added test suite: {suite.name}")
 35
 36    def add_test_case(self, suite_name: str, test_case: TestCase) -> None:
 37        """Add test case to existing suite."""
 38        if suite_name in self._test_suites:
 39            self._test_suites[suite_name].test_cases.append(test_case)
 40            self._logger.info(f"Added test case {test_case.name} to suite {suite_name}")
 41
 42    async def run_test_suite(self, suite_name: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 43        """Run complete test suite."""
 44        try:
 45            if suite_name not in self._test_suites:
 46                raise ValueError(f"Test suite {suite_name} not found")
 47
 48            suite = self._test_suites[suite_name]
 49            self._logger.info(f"Running test suite: {suite_name}")
 50
 51            start_time = time.time()
 52            results = []
 53
 54            # Setup suite
 55            await self._execute_setup_commands(suite.setup_suite)
 56
 57            # Execute test cases
 58            if suite.parallel_execution:
 59                results = await self._run_parallel_tests(suite)
 60            else:
 61                results = await self._run_sequential_tests(suite)
 62
 63            # Teardown suite
 64            await self._execute_teardown_commands(suite.teardown_suite)
 65
 66            end_time = time.time()
 67
 68            # Generate suite report
 69            suite_result = {
 70                'suite_name': suite_name,
 71                'start_time': start_time,
 72                'end_time': end_time,
 73                'duration': end_time - start_time,
 74                'total_tests': len(results),
 75                'passed': sum(1 for r in results if r.status == TestStatus.PASSED),
 76                'failed': sum(1 for r in results if r.status == TestStatus.FAILED),
 77                'errors': sum(1 for r in results if r.status == TestStatus.ERROR),
 78                'results': results
 79            }
 80
 81            self._logger.info(f"Completed test suite {suite_name}: "
 82                            f"{suite_result['passed']}/{suite_result['total_tests']} passed")
 83
 84            return suite_result
 85
 86        except Exception as e:
 87            self._logger.error(f"Error running test suite {suite_name}: {e}")
 88            return {'suite_name': suite_name, 'error': str(e)}
 89
 90    async def run_test_case(self, test_case: TestCase) -> TestResult:
 91        """Run individual test case."""
 92        try:
 93            self._current_test = test_case
 94            self._logger.info(f"Running test case: {test_case.name}")
 95
 96            start_time = time.time()
 97
 98            # Setup test
 99            await self._execute_setup_commands(test_case.setup_commands)
100            await self._apply_initial_conditions(test_case.initial_conditions)
101
102            # Execute test
103            result = await self._execute_test_case(test_case)
104
105            # Teardown test
106            await self._execute_teardown_commands(test_case.teardown_commands)
107
108            end_time = time.time()
109            result.duration = end_time - start_time
110
111            self._test_results.append(result)
112            self._current_test = None
113
114            self._logger.info(f"Test case {test_case.name} completed: {result.status.value}")
115            return result
116
117        except Exception as e:
118            self._logger.error(f"Error running test case {test_case.name}: {e}")
119            return TestResult(
120                test_name=test_case.name,
121                status=TestStatus.ERROR,
122                start_time=start_time,
123                end_time=time.time(),
124                duration=time.time() - start_time,
125                error_message=str(e)
126            )
127
128    async def run_all_suites(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
129        """Run all configured test suites."""
130        try:
131            self._logger.info("Running all test suites")
132            suite_results = {}
133
134            for suite_name in self._test_suites:
135                result = await self.run_test_suite(suite_name)
136                suite_results[suite_name] = result
137
138            # Generate comprehensive report
139            report = await self._report_generator.generate_comprehensive_report(
140                suite_results, self._test_results
141            )
142
143            return report
144
145        except Exception as e:
146            self._logger.error(f"Error running all test suites: {e}")
147            return {'error': str(e)}
148
149    async def _run_sequential_tests(self, suite: TestSuite) -> List[TestResult]:
150        """Run test cases sequentially."""
151        results = []
152        for test_case in suite.test_cases:
153            result = await self.run_test_case(test_case)
154            results.append(result)
155        return results
156
157    async def _run_parallel_tests(self, suite: TestSuite) -> List[TestResult]:
158        """Run test cases in parallel."""
159        semaphore = asyncio.Semaphore(suite.max_parallel)
160
161        async def run_with_semaphore(test_case):
162            async with semaphore:
163                return await self.run_test_case(test_case)
164
165        tasks = [run_with_semaphore(tc) for tc in suite.test_cases]
166        return await asyncio.gather(*tasks)
167
168    async def _execute_test_case(self, test_case: TestCase) -> TestResult:
169        """Execute individual test case logic."""
170        result = TestResult(
171            test_name=test_case.name,
172            status=TestStatus.RUNNING,
173            start_time=time.time(),
174            end_time=0.0,
175            duration=0.0
176        )
177
178        try:
179            # Apply test inputs
180            await self._apply_test_inputs(test_case.test_inputs)
181
182            # Inject faults if specified
183            for fault_scenario in test_case.fault_scenarios:
184                await self._hil_system._fault_injector.execute_scenario(fault_scenario)
185
186            # Collect data and validate assertions
187            await self._run_test_assertions(test_case, result)
188
189            # Determine overall test result
190            if result.assertions_failed == 0:
191                result.status = TestStatus.PASSED
192            else:
193                result.status = TestStatus.FAILED
194
195        except asyncio.TimeoutError:
196            result.status = TestStatus.FAILED
197            result.error_message = f"Test timeout after {test_case.timeout}s"
198
199        except Exception as e:
200            result.status = TestStatus.ERROR
201            result.error_message = str(e)
202
203        result.end_time = time.time()
204        return result
205
206    async def _run_test_assertions(self, test_case: TestCase, result: TestResult) -> None:
207        """Run test assertions and collect results."""
208        test_start = time.time()
209        assertion_tasks = []
210
211        # Start assertion monitoring tasks
212        for assertion in test_case.assertions:
213            task = asyncio.create_task(
214                self._monitor_assertion(assertion, test_start, test_case.duration)
215            )
216            assertion_tasks.append(task)
217
218        # Wait for test duration or all assertions to complete
219        try:
220            await asyncio.wait_for(
221                asyncio.gather(*assertion_tasks),
222                timeout=test_case.timeout
223            )
224        except asyncio.TimeoutError:
225            # Cancel remaining tasks
226            for task in assertion_tasks:
227                task.cancel()
228
229        # Collect assertion results
230        for i, task in enumerate(assertion_tasks):
231            try:
232                if task.done() and not task.cancelled():
233                    assertion_result = await task
234                    if assertion_result['passed']:
235                        result.assertions_passed += 1
236                    else:
237                        result.assertions_failed += 1
238                    self._assertion_results.append(assertion_result)
239                else:
240                    result.assertions_failed += 1
241            except Exception as e:
242                result.assertions_failed += 1
243                self._logger.error(f"Assertion {test_case.assertions[i].name} error: {e}")
244
245    async def _monitor_assertion(self, assertion: TestAssertion,
246                               start_time: float, duration: float) -> Dict[str, Any]:
247        """Monitor and validate test assertion."""
248        try:
249            assertion_result = {
250                'name': assertion.name,
251                'type': assertion.assertion_type.value,
252                'target_signal': assertion.target_signal,
253                'expected_value': assertion.expected_value,
254                'passed': False,
255                'actual_value': None,
256                'timestamp': None,
257                'error_message': None
258            }
259
260            end_time = start_time + duration
261            check_interval = 0.01  # 10ms check interval
262
263            while time.time() < end_time:
264                # Get current signal value
265                current_value = await self._get_signal_value(assertion.target_signal)
266
267                # Validate assertion
268                validation_result = self._validate_assertion(assertion, current_value)
269
270                if validation_result['passed']:
271                    assertion_result.update({
272                        'passed': True,
273                        'actual_value': current_value,
274                        'timestamp': time.time() - start_time
275                    })
276                    break
277
278                await asyncio.sleep(check_interval)
279
280            # If assertion never passed, record final state
281            if not assertion_result['passed']:
282                final_value = await self._get_signal_value(assertion.target_signal)
283                assertion_result.update({
284                    'actual_value': final_value,
285                    'timestamp': duration,
286                    'error_message': f"Assertion failed: expected {assertion.expected_value}, got {final_value}"
287                })
288
289            return assertion_result
290
291        except Exception as e:
292            return {
293                'name': assertion.name,
294                'passed': False,
295                'error_message': str(e)
296            }
297
298    def _validate_assertion(self, assertion: TestAssertion, actual_value: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
299        """Validate individual assertion."""
300        try:
301            if assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.EQUALS:
302                passed = abs(float(actual_value) - float(assertion.expected_value)) <= assertion.tolerance
303
304            elif assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.LESS_THAN:
305                passed = float(actual_value) < float(assertion.expected_value)
306
307            elif assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.GREATER_THAN:
308                passed = float(actual_value) > float(assertion.expected_value)
309
310            elif assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.WITHIN_RANGE:
311                min_val, max_val = assertion.expected_value
312                passed = min_val <= float(actual_value) <= max_val
313
314            elif assertion.assertion_type == AssertionType.WITHIN_TOLERANCE:
315                target_value, tolerance = assertion.expected_value
316                passed = abs(float(actual_value) - float(target_value)) <= tolerance
317
318            else:
319                passed = False
320
321            return {
322                'passed': passed,
323                'actual_value': actual_value
324            }
325
326        except Exception as e:
327            return {
328                'passed': False,
329                'error': str(e)
330            }
331
332    async def _get_signal_value(self, signal_name: str) -> Any:
333        """Get current value of specified signal."""
334        try:
335            # Get signal from HIL system data
336            hil_status = await self._hil_system.get_system_status()
337
338            # Search in input/output data
339            if signal_name in self._hil_system._input_data:
340                return self._hil_system._input_data[signal_name]
341            elif signal_name in self._hil_system._output_data:
342                return self._hil_system._output_data[signal_name]
343            elif signal_name in self._hil_system._simulation_data:
344                return self._hil_system._simulation_data[signal_name]
345            else:
346                # Try to get from devices
347                for device_id in self._hil_system._device_manager.list_devices():
348                    device = self._hil_system._device_manager.get_device(device_id)
349                    data = await device.read_data()
350                    if signal_name in data:
351                        return data[signal_name]
352
353                raise ValueError(f"Signal {signal_name} not found")
354
355        except Exception as e:
356            self._logger.error(f"Error getting signal {signal_name}: {e}")
357            return None
358
359    async def _execute_setup_commands(self, commands: List[str]) -> None:
360        """Execute setup commands."""
361        for command in commands:
362            try:
363                # Parse and execute command
364                await self._execute_command(command)
365            except Exception as e:
366                self._logger.error(f"Setup command failed: {command} - {e}")
367
368    async def _execute_teardown_commands(self, commands: List[str]) -> None:
369        """Execute teardown commands."""
370        for command in commands:
371            try:
372                await self._execute_command(command)
373            except Exception as e:
374                self._logger.error(f"Teardown command failed: {command} - {e}")
375
376    async def _execute_command(self, command: str) -> None:
377        """Execute individual command."""
378        # Simple command parser - would be expanded for specific needs
379        if command.startswith("set_"):
380            # Parse set commands: set_signal_name:value
381            parts = command[4:].split(":")
382            if len(parts) == 2:
383                signal_name, value = parts
384                await self._set_signal_value(signal_name, float(value))
385
386    async def _set_signal_value(self, signal_name: str, value: Any) -> None:
387        """Set signal value in HIL system."""
388        self._hil_system._output_data[signal_name] = value
389
390    async def _apply_initial_conditions(self, conditions: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
391        """Apply initial conditions for test."""
392        for signal_name, value in conditions.items():
393            await self._set_signal_value(signal_name, value)
394
395    async def _apply_test_inputs(self, inputs: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
396        """Apply test inputs."""
397        for signal_name, value in inputs.items():
398            await self._set_signal_value(signal_name, value)

TestReportGenerator¶

Source Code¶

 1class TestReportGenerator:
 2    """Generate comprehensive test reports."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self):
 5        self._logger = logging.getLogger("test_report_generator")
 6
 7    async def generate_comprehensive_report(self, suite_results: Dict[str, Any],
 8                                          test_results: List[TestResult]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 9        """Generate comprehensive test report."""
10        try:
11            report = {
12                'generated_at': time.time(),
13                'summary': self._generate_summary(suite_results, test_results),
14                'suite_results': suite_results,
15                'detailed_results': [self._result_to_dict(r) for r in test_results],
16                'statistics': self._generate_statistics(test_results),
17                'recommendations': self._generate_recommendations(test_results)
18            }
19
20            return report
21
22        except Exception as e:
23            self._logger.error(f"Error generating report: {e}")
24            return {'error': str(e)}
25
26    def _generate_summary(self, suite_results: Dict[str, Any],
27                         test_results: List[TestResult]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
28        """Generate test summary."""
29        total_tests = len(test_results)
30        passed = sum(1 for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.PASSED)
31        failed = sum(1 for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.FAILED)
32        errors = sum(1 for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.ERROR)
33
34        return {
35            'total_suites': len(suite_results),
36            'total_tests': total_tests,
37            'passed': passed,
38            'failed': failed,
39            'errors': errors,
40            'success_rate': passed / max(1, total_tests),
41            'total_duration': sum(r.duration for r in test_results)
42        }
43
44    def _generate_statistics(self, test_results: List[TestResult]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
45        """Generate test statistics."""
46        if not test_results:
47            return {}
48
49        durations = [r.duration for r in test_results]
50
51        return {
52            'avg_duration': sum(durations) / len(durations),
53            'max_duration': max(durations),
54            'min_duration': min(durations),
55            'total_assertions': sum(r.assertions_passed + r.assertions_failed for r in test_results),
56            'assertion_success_rate': sum(r.assertions_passed for r in test_results) /
57                                    max(1, sum(r.assertions_passed + r.assertions_failed for r in test_results))
58        }
59
60    def _generate_recommendations(self, test_results: List[TestResult]) -> List[str]:
61        """Generate test recommendations."""
62        recommendations = []
63
64        failed_tests = [r for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.FAILED]
65        if failed_tests:
66            recommendations.append(f"Review {len(failed_tests)} failed test cases for potential issues")
67
68        error_tests = [r for r in test_results if r.status == TestStatus.ERROR]
69        if error_tests:
70            recommendations.append(f"Fix {len(error_tests)} test cases with execution errors")
71
72        return recommendations
73
74    def _result_to_dict(self, result: TestResult) -> Dict[str, Any]:
75        """Convert test result to dictionary."""
76        return {
77            'test_name': result.test_name,
78            'status': result.status.value,
79            'start_time': result.start_time,
80            'end_time': result.end_time,
81            'duration': result.duration,
82            'assertions_passed': result.assertions_passed,
83            'assertions_failed': result.assertions_failed,
84            'error_message': result.error_message,
85            'performance_metrics': result.performance_metrics
86        }
